ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Basic knowledge related to environmental engineering, and I have a deep understanding of the mechanisms of different wastewater treatments.
It covers a lot of materials relating to physiochemical processes.
A deep overview of all things water-treatment
An overview of environmental physiochemical processes relevant to water treatment processes with a focus on ties to past and current research foci.
An overview on environmental physicochemical processes including - absorption - membrane processes - chemical aspects - basics of transport

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strength is that the course is very organized and the professor knows the stuff. There are no significant weaknesses.
Lectures were informative, sometimes problem sets felt excessively time-consuming

The only real weakness which is more of a personal preference is that I find it difficult to learn from power points and I appreciate when the derivations are done on the chalkboard. Generally this course is a great course and provides a really detailed overview of relevant water related research topics taught by an expert in the field.
Thorough presentation material, he waits for you to get the notes down as well as explain everything at a reasonable pace. Easy to follow and can learn a lot in class

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, Professor is really nice and the course is well organized, interesting, have a lot of knowledge from learning.
YES! very important for environmental engineering students.
Yes, because it is very organized and intellectually-stimulating
Yes, if you are hoping to go into water related research this course is a great starting point that provides a nice overview of the relevant topics.
Yes, a great introductory course if there is an interest in environmental processes, especially for engineering applications.
